intro: Hydrobryum taeniatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed water moss, is a member of the family Pottiaceae and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. It is a small, cushion-like moss that thrives in rocky or soil substrates, often in temperate regions. The plant has a dense, compact growth form with narrow, elongated leaves that are usually slightly curled at the tips. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Hydrobryum taeniatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
